column1: While this is good news the fact remains that this delay caused unnecessary risk to our national security and public health. We must put country over party as we move forward during these difficult times.   https://t.co/NAhrszqozP

I spoke with @kasie today about what it takes to win purple places like Chester County where we're 40% Democrat 40% Republican and 20% Independent.   My message: we need pragmatic bipartisan representatives committed to delivering results for Pennsylvanians. https://t.co/9wwH2qNKZy

A concession is not just about the candidate; it’s about the country. It is a sign that the American democracy still stands after a chaotic election. It reminds us that we all may come together and share the same truth. Because truth and decency matter. https://t.co/oZZmNoGxTu

President Trump even on #VeteransDay was placing his own interests above those of the country possibly risking lives and our national security. As a veteran who wore the uniform and served our country I'm concerned. We all should be.   I talked to @JoyAnnReid about why: https://t.co/n0tHYMklfh

Today and every day we honor those who've served this country. As a third generation veteran I want to take this #VeteransDay to  thank all those who've served. May this day be the start of a healing process for this nation as we seek to move forward in unity.
Over 300000 Pennsylvanians have health care because of the Affordable Care Act. To try and strike down this lifesaving law during a pandemic is unconscionable.  https://t.co/BMkFO2ZPEo
Hello science my old friend. https://t.co/uX7TzLEqTv
Civility and decency won.   President-elect Joe Biden.   Vice President-elect Kamala Harris.  🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸
A wise man and legend. It’s our job to carry the promise. https://t.co/WAl3CfiEOq
Good morning Pennsylvania!
Whether you supported this campaign or not please know that we are in this together. I will serve and stand up for each and every one of you here at home and in Washington. 5/5
The opportunity to again serve you the people of Pennsylvania’s 6th Congressional District in Congress is the privilege and honor of a lifetime. /4

I’d also like to thank my opponent Mr. John Emmons and his family for stepping up to run. I know firsthand particularly during this divided time what a sacrifice that is and what a true service it is. /3
Together we ran a campaign based on the fundamental values of civility and decency and that message once again resonated throughout our community. /2
I want to thank my team and the people of our community who together powered my campaign. I am inspired by your spirit faith and commitment. /1 https://t.co/nEMBHSer21

I want to thank everyone who came out yesterday who made their voice heard who volunteered and more.   Now as hard as it is we must exercise patience as the votes are counted. Every eligible vote must be counted. We're in this together.
Stay in line. https://t.co/i2b9Qoq66J

Polls are open till 8pm tonight in our Pennsylvania. If you haven't gotten out to vote yet there's still time. As long as you're in line by 8 you can vote. Plus you'll get treated to this incredible sunset. https://t.co/6UQc3k00Tx

I'm grateful to the Pennsylvanians who volunteered today. These are unprecedented times but in their determination to ensure a safe and fair election I see the American spirit. Your voice is your vote.  Let’s do this PA! #VOTE

What has been clear from the beginning of Joe Biden's campaign is an unwavering commitment to the American people and addressing the most pressing issues of our time. It stands in stark contrast to President Trump and it's why we're going to deliver PA to Joe Biden.   One day. https://t.co/88l0nPASRd

Refusing to vote on a COVID relief bill the Senate is instead voting to confirm a Justice who represents a grave threat to the Affordable Care Act and by extension a threat to the millions of Americans who rely on it. And yes all of this in the middle of a pandemic.

Women across our Commonwealth are exhausted. We're ready for new leadership. Since 2016 we've seen women step up and participate in our democracy in record numbers. The people of our community and Commonwealth appreciated elected officials who are willing to listen and have conversations who are open to connecting with each and every voter. It is something I’ve tried to emulate and model in our community. /2

When President Trump won I remember my daughter breaking down in tears feeling that the LGBTQ+ community among so many others had been left behind.   On this #NationalComingOutDay  I just want to say that we see you and we will stand by you. You are worthy. 🏳️‍🌈

Great to be in Reading today w/ @ReElectNydia @JoshShapiroPA and other local Democrats to spread the word: PA is going blue! Vote like our democracy depends on it...(because it does).   PS: I let my shoes do some of the talking today 😉 https://t.co/uUaLJmUEVY

In our mourning we find strength as a community. Let us mourn the loss of a visionary and an icon but continue the march that she helped lead towards a more just and equal society. Let’s do it for Ruth. 5/5
We do that by sending Joe Biden to the White House removing Mitch McConnell's majority in the Senate and holding the hard-fought people’s House. /4
We must send a clear message on November 3rd that we stand on the side of the people on the side of justice on the side of every Americans' rights. /3

What is on the ballot is no longer a question just Democrat vs. Republican - but a question of the laws and freedoms we cherish - access to health care women's rights LGBTQ+ rights voting rights and so much more. /2

Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was known for so many memorable quotes but one of my favorites is “Real change enduring change happens one step at a time.” We must channel her quiet will and unrelenting determination. /1

A legend and icon died today. I feel as though I owe my career to Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg as do so many of my generation and others that followed. She was an American treasure. May we all lead and learn from her. Such a life well lived.
To those in our community Commonwealth and country celebrating Rosh Hashanah tonight I wish you all a safe and healthy new year. L'shana Tova!

We cannot let this moment pass without acknowledging the historic nature of the first ever woman of color being chosen to serve as our party's Vice Presidential nominee. /5

Kamala Harris has a long & proven track record of service. She has consistently stood up for Americans' health care and the Affordable Care Act fought for a safer planet and worked to build an economy that works for everyone. I'm proud to serve alongside her in Congress. /2
